Size Classes in Tailwind CSS

Notes on Size Utilities

Tailwind CSS provides size utilities that allow you to set both width and height of an element simultaneously using the size- prefix. These utilities are useful for creating square elements or maintaining aspect ratios. Size classes combine width and height into a single class, making it easier to manage dimensions for icons, avatars, or other square components.

  • Fixed Sizes: Use classes like size-4 (1rem), size-8 (2rem), up to size-96 (24rem).
  • Arbitrary Values: size-[100px] for custom sizes.
  • Responsive Sizes: Combine with breakpoints like md:size-32.

Syntax Examples

Fixed Size

size-24

Sets both width and height to 6rem (96px).

Large Size

size-96

Sets both width and height to 24rem (384px).

Arbitrary Size

size-[200px]

Sets both width and height to 200px.

Responsive Size

md:size-32

Sets size to 8rem on medium screens and up.
